message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis utilizes multiple datasets including the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the International Finance Corporation's Doing Business database to examine the relationship between electricity access and firm productivity in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "International Finance Corporation's Doing Business database"], "topic": ["Energy", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on a unique dataset of credit records from multiple lenders in Kenya as well as survey data on small business owners to investigate the impact of fintech lending on financial inclusion.", "dataset": ["credit records from multiple lenders in Kenya"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to analyze the impact of climate change on child health in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from India's Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) and the Industrial Entrepreneurship Memorandum (IEM), we explore the relationship between exporter dynamics and technology upgrading.", "dataset": ["India's Annual Survey of Industries (ASI)", "Industrial Entrepreneurship Memorandum (IEM)"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We use a dataset of annual firm-level balance sheet data covering over 500,000 firms across 130 countries to investigate the relationship between financial market development and income inequality.", "dataset": ["firm-level balance sheet data"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This paper combines satellite imagery data with household survey data from the Tanzania National Panel Survey (TNPS) to assess the role of crop insurance in reducing income volatility and improving household welfare.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "Tanzania National Panel Survey (TNPS)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset of over 200 mining projects from around the world to examine the impact of extractive industries on local economic development.", "dataset": ["panel dataset of over 200 mining projects"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Regional Integration"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Health and Retirement Study (HRS), we investigate the effects of social security reform on labor supply for older workers in the United States.", "dataset": ["Health and Retirement Study (HRS)"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a nationally representative dataset of Mexican firms between 2012-2018 to analyze the role of corporate governance reforms in improving firm-level productivity.", "dataset": ["nationally representative dataset of Mexican firms between 2012-2018"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We use a novel dataset of 911 call records from New York City and apply machine learning techniques to predict the types of emergency calls and identify areas with higher probability of certain types of emergencies.", "dataset": ["911 call records from New York City"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis draws on multiple datasets including the World Bank's Women, Business, and the Law database and the International Labour Organization's Women in Business and Management database to investigate the relationship between gender diversity and firm performance.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Women, Business, and the Law database", "International Labour Organization's Women in Business and Management database"], "topic": ["Gender", "Competitiveness"]}]
